jQuery Wiggle

This jQuery plugin allows you to emulate the wiggle effect icons on an iPhone have when you press and hold down on them.
Language Javascript
License MIT
Version 2.0.0
Release date January 22, 2017
Download zip archive
Source git clone https://github.com/sizeofcat/jquery-wiggle.git

Setup

First you need to include the jQuery library, since Wiggle is a plugin. You can download it from the jQuery website or link it directly from the Google CDN.

<script src="//ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.1.1/jquery.min.js"></script>

Secondly, you need to include the jQuery Wiggle javascript file into your page. You can do it by adding the code below to your page.

<script src="js/jquery-wiggle.js"></script>

Next, you create the image tag that you want to apply wiggle on.

<img class="wiggle" src="images/image1.jpg" />
<img class="wiggle" src="images/image2.jpg" />

As the last step, you trigger the catWiggle() function on the element you just created. In this case, we trigger the function on the image with the class wiggle.

$(document).ready(function() {
    $('.wiggle').catWiggle();
});

Settings

Name Default Description
degrees Array object which outlines the cycle of rotation for a wiggle increment.
delay 35 Allows you to specify, in milliseconds, the delay between switching from one rotation degree to the next (see degrees); a higher number creates a slower “wiggle”.
limit null Specify the maximum number of wiggles, null which means infinite wiggles.
random_start true Boolean value which tells the plugin to start wiggling all matched elements at the same degree or a random one.

Callbacks

Name Description
on_wiggle Event that is fired off with the end of each wiggle.
on_wiggle_start Event that is fired off when the wiggling effect first starts.
on_wiggle_stop Event that is fired off when the wiggling effect is stopped.

Methods

Name Description
start() Starts the wiggle effect.
stop() Stops the wiggle effect.
is_wiggling() Can be used to determine if the matched element is currently “wiggling”.
